greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of n^2 + 1.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(7) = 6 because 7^2+1 = 50 and the 6 divisors are { 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50}.
maple: with(numtheory):for n from 0 to 110 do:n1:=nops(divisors(n^2+1)):s:=0:for m from 1 to n1 do: s:=s+1:od: printf(`%d, `, s):od:
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Jul 28 2011
